ThingDef.label: Red bandana
ThingDef.description: A simple headwrap tied from a long strip of dark-red cloth. Provides a bit of warmth and padding for the noggin'.

ThingDef.label: hood
ThingDef.description: A draped hood which covers the head and ears.

ThingDef.label: coif
ThingDef.description: A close-fitting and lightly padded coif often worn beneath mail or a helmet, or on its own for warmth in cold weather.

ThingDef.label: Arming Cap
ThingDef.description: A thickly padded cap most often worn beneath heavier helmets for an additional layer of protection. Quite insulating and offers a bit of blunt protection on its own.

ThingDef.label: full arming cap
ThingDef.description: A thickly padded hood most often worn beneath heavier helmets for an additional layer of protection. Very insulating and offers a bit of blunt protection on its own.

ThingDef.label: Cultist Hood
ThingDef.description: A thickly padded cap most often worn beneath heavier helmets for an additional layer of protection. Quite insulating and offers a bit of blunt protection on its own.

ThingDef.label: zweihander's hat
ThingDef.description: A thick, ornamented hat. Protective simply due to its size and shape, but mainly worn for decoration and as a status symbol.

ThingDef.label: padded nasal helm
ThingDef.description: A strong medieval helmet that provides full-head coverage. While it offers fantastic protection, ones vision is grealy obscured, thus it is only recommended for front line infantry, particularly those foregoing shields.

ThingDef.label: padded kettle
ThingDef.description: A wide-rimmed kettle helmet paired with a thick padded coif, offering good protection of the head.

ThingDef.label: padded flat top
ThingDef.description: A thick padded coif coupled with a simple flat-top nasal helmet. Offers good protection of the head, and is also quite insulating in cold weather.

ThingDef.label: chain coif
ThingDef.description: A thick hood forged from chains of metal provides excellent protection to the head against slashing and thrusting attacks.

ThingDef.label: closed chain coif
ThingDef.description: A thick hood forged from chains of metal with additional protection reinforcing the lower face. Provides excellent protection to the entire head against piercing and slashing attacks.

ThingDef.label: full chain coif
ThingDef.description: A thick hood forged from chains of metal with an added plate-metal noseguard to almost entirely protect the face, head,. Makes it a bit difficult to see, but otherwise offers excellent protection against cuts.

ThingDef.label: chain nasal helm
ThingDef.description: A chainmail coif coupled with a simple round nasal helmet, offering excellent protection of the head.

ThingDef.label: chain nasal helm (bandana)
ThingDef.description: A variation of the chain skull cap crafted as a chainmail coif coupled with a nasal helmet. Offers the same level of protection for the head, but the strip of red cloth tied around the forehead displays authority.

ThingDef.label: chain kettle helm
ThingDef.description: A wide-rimmed kettle helmet paired with a chainmail coif, offering excellent protection of the head while providing comfortable shade from the sun.

ThingDef.label: chain flat-top
ThingDef.description: A strong medieval helmet that provides full-head coverage. While it offers fantastic protection, ones vision is grealy obscured, thus it is only recommended for front line infantry, particularly those foregoing shields.

ThingDef.label: closed chain flat-top
ThingDef.description: A strong medieval helmet that provides full-head coverage. While it offers fantastic protection, ones vision is grealy obscured, thus it is only recommended for front line infantry, particularly those foregoing shields.

ThingDef.label: chain closed flat-top
ThingDef.description: An early design of the full-faced helmet, consisting of a reinforced flat-top helmet with an additional face-plate and a mail coif. Offers great protection of the entire head, but hinders eyesight and breathing.

ThingDef.label: heavy barbrute
ThingDef.description: A formidable heavy barbute helmet, crafted from robust and weighty steel. This design, known for its exceptional durability, provides substantial protection while retaining its imposing presence on the battlefield.

ThingDef.Name: DankPyon_T3HelmetBase
ThingDef.label: open bascinet
ThingDef.description: The open bascinet helmet features a conical shape with a retractable visor, allowing for versatility in protection and visibility. It offers defense to the head while granting improved breathability and vision compared to fully enclosed helmets. Though it sacrifices some protection, its open design ensures greater comfort and ease of movement for wearers in combat scenarios.

ThingDef.Name: DankPyon_ZweihanderHelmBase
ThingDef.label: zweihander helm
ThingDef.description: A sturdy metal helmet adorned with a flamboyant colored large baggy feathered hat to display one's status.

ThingDef.label: closed bascinet helmet
ThingDef.description: A thick plate bascinet helmet coupled with a round-faced visor, paired with a chainmail coif and padding. Provides complete protection of the entire head, but is hindering to see and difficult to breathe in.

ThingDef.label: wolf-ribs bascinet
ThingDef.description: A thick plate bascinet helmet coupled with a round-faced visor, paired with a chainmail coif and padding. Provides complete protection of the entire head, but is hindering to see and difficult to breathe in.

ThingDef.label: klappviser bascinet
ThingDef.description: A thick plate bascinet helmet coupled with a round-faced visor, paired with a chainmail coif and padding. Provides complete protection of the entire head, but is hindering to see and difficult to breathe in.

ThingDef.Name: DankPyon_SalletBase
ThingDef.label: visored sallet
ThingDef.description: A sleek three-part helmet consisting of a top, visor, and bevor to protect the head, face, respectively. Lightweight, and very protective, though it hinders eyesight significantly.

ThingDef.label: bellow face sallet
ThingDef.description: A sleek three-part helmet consisting of a top, visor, and bevor to protect the head, face, respectively. Lightweight, and very protective, though it hinders eyesight significantly.

ThingDef.label: gryphon sallet
ThingDef.description: A sleek three-part helmet consisting of a top, visor, and bevor to protect the head, face, respectively. Lightweight, and very protective, though it hinders eyesight significantly.

ThingDef.label: closed klappvisier helmet
ThingDef.description: A simple plate bascinet helmet with an affixed flip-up visor. Offers good protection of the head and face, but it hinders one's eyesight while wearing it.

ThingDef.label: great helm
ThingDef.description: An early design of the close helm, which is worn over a very thickly padded fabric coif. Provides excellent protection to the entire head, but, like with most full-face helmets, limits one's field of vision and constricts breathing when worn.

ThingDef.Name: DankPyon_HeraldicGreatHelm
ThingDef.label: heraldic great helm (Amboise)
ThingDef.description: A greatly ornamented full-plate great helmet, often worn by jousters and heraldic champions and notable figures of notable houses in war. Portrays one’s noble status while still offering considerable protection in battle. \n\nThis great helm carries the colours of house Amboise.

ThingDef.label: armet
ThingDef.description: A finely crafted, ergonomically shaped plate helmet that provides complete protection of the entire head, face,, shaped in such a way to optimize deflection of what would otherwise be direct blows.

ThingDef.label: gilded armet
ThingDef.description: A finely crafted, ergonomically shaped plate helmet that provides complete protection of the entire head, face,, shaped in such a way to optimize deflection of what would otherwise be direct blows.

ThingDef.label: named armet
ThingDef.description: An ancient ornate armet masterfully smithed by the under-forges of the ancient empire. It gives great protection for one's visage and embelishes an awe inspiring grace.

ThingDef.label: lindwurm scale helmet
ThingDef.description: A scaly helmet from a lindwurm's scales. Wearing the helmet displays owner's strength, as it is proof that they have slain a dangerous lindwurm to don the trophy. \n\nGrants immunity to lindwurm acid.
